turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, no... But Mark -- a jealous boyfriend gone mad. Maybe he kills men you date.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Mark wouldn't hurt a fly.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: But you said the bodies were ripped to pieces?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Still haven't figured out how he or anyone else pulled that off. Never seen anything like it.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, why?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He was ripped to shreds also. In his apartment.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Frida. I was looking for you. You changing jobs?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yeah sort of. Where's Lloyd?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I need to talk to you. About us. Frida... I... Can I carry your box?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, I got it. It's okay.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I thought we were starting something... and then... I know it's unorthodox, I mean with you being involved in the case and all.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I just don't know if I should be dating anyone right now.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, every guy you date winds up dead.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Except Mark of course.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What's that supposed to mean?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Did I tell you I have the worst sense of humor and I make bad jokes at totally inappropriate times?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, but thanks for the warning.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Speaking of Mark -- we've tried to track him down and there's no sight of him. Vanished into thin air. I got a hunch he fled the country.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Interesting possibility.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That's it? Hell my mom chased my dad around with a knife when she had it. She made us call her a different name. She'd say, "You're talking to Betty now" and we'd leave the house for a few days.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: This is a lot worse than "Betty."

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You can't mean that. I'm sure your bark is worse than your bite.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, my bite's a lot worse.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is it that funny?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, it's just... no one's ever said that. And I thought if someone did ever say it, I'd have to say it first and then they'd sort of say "I love you too" cause they felt they had to after I'd said it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Is that how you feel?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Like I had to say it? No, I wanted to say it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You didn't say it.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I love you too.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What's with the squirt guns?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: They're for my cat. I use them to train him not to rip up paper.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know, I've never seen your cat.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I loaned him to Jennifer. George moved out and she was lonely...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Your breasts feel larger.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: They do? Oh no...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No, it's a good thing. I like it. Everything about you is great. I like how you don't shave your legs. Women are so much sexier when they're natural.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I did shave... Do I seem hairy? Peter laughs.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No. But I don't mind hairy. Are you okay?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Frida? You okay? Look, I think I know what happened to Mark. I want to help. I'm coming over.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: NO! Don't come over. Peter... I... I don't want to see you anymore. Ever.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What? Is there someone else?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yes, sort of. I mean no, not really.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes or no? Frida, can't you just be honest with me?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You at least owe me the truth.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: You want the truth? Remember I tried to tell you something the other day?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yes, your PMS. Frida I can deal with that.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No you can't. It... it gets so bad that I become a werewolf.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: If you don't like me, just say so. You don't have to make up some bullshit like you're a werewolf.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I knew you wouldn't believe me! Just go away. Go very far away!

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Go away. I might hurt you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm not afraid. Frida! I love you.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Peter I love you too but...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't think you'll hurt me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't think you would. No matter what form you take.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I can't take that chance... I couldn't live with myself if I did anything to you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I have the silver bullets in case I need to protect myself. Does that make you feel better?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Be careful!

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Can't you bite me and then I'll be like you?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. It doesn't work that way. Men can't get PMS. Unfortunately.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm staying here with you tonight. There's no getting rid of me.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I knew you wouldn't kill me.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Maybe we should have children. I don't think I'd kill the father of my child.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We can work this out. Other couples have worse problems.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Worse than this?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Sure. Cheating, lying. What's a little werewolf a few days a month? We can move out to the country where you can feed off deer.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What about... those guys... I might have...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No way can anything be proved. All they have are some wolf hairs. No one believes in werewolves.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I'm so sorry... I... I couldn't help it. You know I didn't mean to... to do any of that.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I know. The important thing is that it stop.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I'm going to take a shower.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Here's a towel.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: That I'm a doormat of course. The shrink makes more notes.

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: Oh, I see... interesting theory.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I think I'm a werewolf.

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: Let's explore this. What makes you feel you're a werewolf?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I ate a guy last night.

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: And how did you feel when you ate this guy?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: I don't know. I don't remember doing it.

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: Dreams about killing usually signify feelings of guilt. You had sex last night and you feel guilty.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: We didn't have sex.

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: You say you killed a man and don't remember it. Couldn't you have had sex and not remember it? It's sexual. Why did you choose "eating him" as the method of killing?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Cause I'm a fucking werewolf!!

turns.speaker: SHRINK
turns.text: You use the word "fucking." You're sexualizing things. Stop berating yourself. It's okay to have sex.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It's about Gregory Jameson. He's dead.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Oh my god, what happened?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yes... I... we had dinner.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Did he come home with you? Did you go to his apartment?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, it was our first date.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Looks like it was your only date. Unless you go to his funeral.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: A kiss? Did you have sex with him?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, I said it was our first date.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: We can get a warrant if you like.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, take it.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You heard about Carlton Fraser?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: Yes, Jennifer told me. What does that have to do with me?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Seems you were the last to see Carlton alive. And the last to see Gregory alive.

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: What makes you think I was the last one?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No. We left the restaurant, and... and I felt sick... so... so I took a cab home. Alone.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You got a dog?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No, I have a cat.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: How big?

turns.speaker: FRIDA
turns.text: No he's not. He's a courier. He picks up packages from the airport.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Packages of money.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So I asked the bartender what "coyote ugly" meant. It's like the "bagger" system. You know, a two- bagger -- someone so ugly that you need two bags -- one bag to put on their head and another one in case it blows off. Or a three-bagger...

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Two bags for them, and one bag for your head in case her two fall off.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: He was saying that when women are close friends they get their periods at the same time.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Yeah and when we're mad at each other we're out of sync. It only works if you're on good terms.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Come on, I've been working with Frida. Carlton won't even recognize her now. She's really coming out of her shell.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She's just so... pathetic.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: She's just insecure. Once you get to know her she's fabulous.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: She'll talk about PMS and stare at her salad.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I wonder how Frida and Carlton are getting along?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Carlton insisted on leaving with her. Maybe he got lucky.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: So now being with Frida is lucky? I thought you said she was a flake.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: It's for you. Frida.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Tell her I'm eating.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I'm supposed to put up with a fuckin' cat I'm allergic to cause your friend's got PMS?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: It's so bad she becomes a werewolf.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You have some weird friends. What does her thinking she's a werewolf have to do with us having the cat?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Don't be stupid George. Obviously if she's a werewolf, she can't be around a cat. She might eat it and besides, cats are afraid of wolves.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Oh great. What the fuck am I supposed to do?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Take some allergy medicine.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: You can't believe this bullshit.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: She's my best friend. I gotta be there for her -- no matter how crazy it sounds. I've been in some bad relationships and she's been there for me. She's lonely. If pretending she's a werewolf helps, then more power to her.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Jesus Christ she got her period. Relax guys. It happens.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Yeah, sorry. Uh... Gregory's roommate told us you were out with him last night.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: How the hell is that your business?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We're just trying to figure out what happened.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: You want her sheets?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We can just take this pillowcase.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I was thinking about becoming a cop myself. Do you take a test or something or just sign up?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why would you want to be a cop?

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't know, I guess the outfits are cool. And I want a big gun.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: See he was cheating from the get go.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He's been running money for the Mafia.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Nah, I don't wanna break up with Wanda, I just wanna see Carmen too.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Man, you're livin' dangerously. Let me ask you somethin', you always have to get women drunk before they'll sleep with you?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You kiddin'? They try to get ME drunk.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You're some catch Lloyd.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hey, you hear about the chick that came in today? Said some chick bit her at Victoria's Secret. Bitches are outta control these days.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He was found a few blocks away.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Torn apart. Limb from limb. A bloody gruesome mess.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I didn't trust her. All that blood on the sheets. She may look sweet, but she could be a wolf in sheep's clothing. Something's weird.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: That dude was torn limb from limb. No way a woman like that could have done it. You never seen blood on a chick's sheets from her period?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hell no, I'm not into that shit. The sight of blood makes me sick.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, so you decide to be a cop? Seriously? You don't have sex with a woman cause she's on the rag?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: No man. Blood is not a turn on. You sure let that Frida off the hook. You weren't even going to take the sheets. If I didn't know better, I'd think you liked her.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I can tell she's not a killer. You just don't like her cause you have a hang up about menstruation.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Nah, man, I'm just saying, you should never date a woman who was the last one to see a guy alive.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Frida's sheets checked out fine. It was just her own blood. From her... you know.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I told you she was innocent.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Hey, there was a lot of blood.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: She was never a suspect Lloyd. Some animal must have done this.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I checked all the zoos. No missing animals. You think a pitbull?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Maybe. What about all those hairs they found on his body?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Waiting for DNA tests. He was hairier than Madonna in Penthouse.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Madonna's in Penthouse?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Back in the '80's. You didn't see the pictures? They were from before she got famous. She was hairy as hell. Her pits, her bush.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hairy women are kind of sexy. Women in their natural state.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: And you think I'm sick?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He was found nearly ripped to shreds in Central Park.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: And he was missing an arm.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I still don't get when you gave her back the pillowcase.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We only live a few blocks apart.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: This is more than fishy, this chick dates a dude and he winds up dead.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay Lloyd, you tell me how she killed them.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: She's got a hidden pitbull. Maybe she hired someone to kill them.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: She's not a suspect. What is her motive? There's nothing, NOTHING connecting her to either crime except that she dated both guys.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Sounds like you got a conflict of interest.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You take the cake Lloyd. Come on, she's not here. Let's check out her psycho ex.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Nah, East Village poseur was grosser than the dude in the park.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: The park dude was missing an arm.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Poseur was missing a chunk of his neck. And his eyes were open. That always bugs me out. Do me a favor, if some mutherfucker's about to blow me away, remind me to close my fuckin' eyes.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Deal. And if some mutherfucker's about to blow me away, shoot him.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Yeah okay. I still say Frida's involved. She's the last one to see two dudes alive...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: She wasn't the last one to see them alive. Whoever killed them was.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: He means the last that we know of.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: This one walk you home too?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Seems he's stolen money from them. He's desperate and our only lead.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: One of our only leads... You had dates with both men right before they were killed.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Spencer's the key here. Frida is in no way associated with him. And her blood hasn't matched with any of the killings.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It's a bit farfetched that Mark would rip guys to shreds just outta jealousy. This makes no sense.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: It's like some fucking monster dropped out of the sky and killed these dudes.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Like a vampire or some shit?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: You think mafia hit?

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Hard to tell. Looks like he's been cleaned up and he's decomposing as we speak. This case gets weirder by the minute.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: It has to be Frida. This makes three guys ripped apart who are tied to her ass.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Okay Lloyd. First, no way does Frida have the physical strength to tear a guy to shreds. Second, why would she be so obvious and let it be known she was the last one to see these guys? Third, she's the one in danger. She's a woman in jeopardy and you're layin' a murder rap on her. Fourth, I look in her eyes and know she's no killer.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: And fifth, you're dating her.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: I know. I followed you. To the zoo, to her house, to your house...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What the fuck are you following me for? I'm not a suspect here.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Which brings up an interesting point. I wasn't following you. I was following the suspect. And you just happened to be there...

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: My girlfriend's predicting another murder in the next few days.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What makes her think that?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: She says she's on the rag every time I get called in to investigate a murder.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: So... they're on some cycle. The murders... Gregory... then 28 days later... Carlton.

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: And that was 28 days ago today.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Did we get those DNA tests back?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Just this morning. Animal hairs were found all over the victims.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: What kind of animal?

turns.speaker: LLOYD
turns.text: Can't figure out the species. Similar to a wolf. They're jokin' at the lab that a werewolf probably killed him. Ain't that the stupidest thing you ever heard?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I need something to keep me awake.

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: Looks like you need a haircut to me.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Thanks.  Just some pills.

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: Only two bucks.  Shave as well...

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Sell maps?

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: What of?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: The city.  I need to get to the ocean.

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: Nope.  No maps.  Ocean, huh?  On vacation?

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: Mnunn.  Cold lately.  That night, couple weeks ago.  That was <u>real</u> cold.  Remember that?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Not really...

turns.speaker: BARBER
turns.text: Yeah, Iím like that.  Senility says the wife.  But she sure canít complain.  Heh.  The erector set still works good.  And this ainít no fucking rug! Gíhead.  Feel it!  All mine!

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: How long have you been here?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Maybe ten minutes...  Thatís strange.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Spinning backwards?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: What's he doing here?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Says he is the man's doctor...  You know...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I <u>know</u> it's his doctor...  I need the file on..  Daniel Paul Schreber M.D.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: All the same entry wounds.  It's definitely him.  She lives...  lived here.  A prostitute.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: The other one?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: His wife.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Jesus.  Small world.  Where's the photographer?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: No one available.

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: They don't speak English...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: How will we interrogate them?

turns.speaker: COP
turns.text: Well, sir...  I don't know exactly.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Police.  Nobody move.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: He tried to kill me!

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Shut up!  Everybody stay calm...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Doctor!  What brings you here?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Just visiting my patient.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Really?  And how is his state of mind?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: He's seriously disturbed...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: You seem a little edgy.  Everything okay?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Yes, of course.  Everything's fine...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: To tell you the truth, I'm glad we've run into each other like this.  Maybe you can help me tidy some loose ends.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Loose ends?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I met a friend of yours the other night, doctor.  Tall fellow.  No hair.  Rather pale skin...

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: That's surprising.  He was leaving your office at the time...

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: You are mistaken.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: Please, they'll kill me...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I think it's time you introduced us to your little friends.

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: In there.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Just like that?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: What is this place?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: You wouldn't believe me if I told you, Inspector.  Have patience  - you'll see for yourself.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Was that for real down there?

turns.speaker: SCHREBER
turns.text: I'm afraid so.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Good evening, sir.

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Yes.  This way.

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Why are you wearing that thing on your face?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Germs, sir.  These places are full of them.

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: I see.  One thingís for sure, heís ambitious. Youíll be a busy man from now on.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: What about Thompson, sir?  Wasnít this his case?

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Thompson suffered a kind of severe delusion or some damn thing.  Anyway he isnít with us any longer.  The case is yours.  Go through his files. Take what you need.  By the way, howís your mother?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Sheís getting better, thanks.  She...

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Why do you want to speak to him?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: A hunch.  He might be able to...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Itís extremely important to my investigation...

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Iíll be the judge of that.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Actually, I was wondering, sir, if you could let me have a few uniforms, to follow up for me...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Lost something?

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: What makes you think that!  If you would learn to concentrate on facts, not get so side-tracked  -  you might get things done faster, Bumstead...

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Yes.  That's right.  He's ill  -  he needs expert help.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I see...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I'm sorry...  But I don't understand how it was possible.  The only window was twenty feet up a vertical wall, he was cuffed...

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: How could you have been so stupid?

turns.speaker: STROMBOLI
turns.text: Bumstead, you're starting to annoy me.  This case is very important to me.  Just a little warning:  I've got my eye on you inspector, remember that.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Dammit!

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Sorry, sir.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Donít ever sneak up on me like that! Who are you?

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Patricia Crenshaw.

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Iím your new assistant.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I didnít requisition a secretary.

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: The Chief-Inspector thought you might need a hand.

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Iíve taken the liberty and had Inspector Thompsonís office searched, as I believe you instructed.  All clear now, sir.  They found several more traps and things were filed under pretty strange categories... Poor man.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: You wonít regret this, sir.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: You typed this report?

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Yes, sir.  Anything wrong?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Wrong?  Look at this!

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: It seems fine.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: <u>Fine</u>?  Look here!

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: How can I submit this?

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Iím sorry...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Do you wash your hands before you type things?

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Why, yes.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Well be more careful, please.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Won't say.  Says he must talk to you.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Put it through...

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: I need everything on the Jonathan White case.

turns.speaker: MISS CRENSHAW
turns.text: Yes, sir.  <u>Everything</u>?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: All the important stuff.  Wrap it up for me.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Where are we going?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Shut-up.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Why give yourself up?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I  -  ah - couldn't think of anything else to do.  I thought maybe you know something...  I'm scared.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: That was a pretty good escape act at the station.  How did you do that?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I woke up in a subway.  I don't know how I got there.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: People...  after me.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: I don't know who they are.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Why are they after you?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Don't know that either.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Don't know much, do you?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: They didn't have faces.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: That's right.  Just seamless flesh across the front of their heads.  No mistake.  I just hadn't remembered it that way.  Up until then they had been normal little girls in my memory.  That's not all.  Once I started examining them, all sorts of things about my life, had... inconsistencies.  It was like a game. I would think about a person or a place, or an event.  Then I would turn the lights off.  Sit down in a comfortable chair...  And study each detail of this subject.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Well.  The only thing I've been certain of, all this time, is that I need to get to the ocean.  The point is no one seems to know how to get there.

turns.speaker: BUMSTEAD
turns.text: Why, that's ridiculous.  You just...
